title: Bitcoin Genesis Block
summary: The Bitcoin Genesis Block, also known as Block 0, is the first block in the Bitcoin blockchain, mined by Satoshi Nakamoto on January 3, 2009. It contained an embedded message, The Times 03-Jan-2009 Chancellor on brink of second bailout for bank.

title: Bitcoin Pizza Day
summary: Laszlo Hanyecz pays 10,000 BTC for two Papa John's pizzas, marking the first and most famous real-world Bitcoin transaction.

title: Silk Road Launches
summary: Ross Ulbricht launches Silk Road, the first major darknet marketplace using Bitcoin for anonymous payments. From February 6, 2011 to July 23, 2013 there were approximately 1,229,465 transactions completed on the site. The total revenue generated from these sales was 9,519,664 Bitcoins, and the total commissions collected by Silk Road from the sales amounted to 614,305 Bitcoins.

title: Mt. Gox First Hack
summary: On June 19th, 2011, a security breach of the Mt. Gox bitcoin exchange caused the nominal price of a bitcoin to fraudulently drop to one cent on the Mt. Gox exchange, after a hacker allegedly used credentials from a Mt. Gox auditor's compromised computer illegally to fabricate a large number of bitcoins for himself.

crimeline.aftermath: Exchange briefly suspended trading and eventually restored prices.

title: First Bitcoin Halving
summary: Bitcoin's block reward halves from 50 BTC to 25 BTC at block 210,000, the first of its kind.

title: Mt. Gox Collapse
summary: On February 7th, 2014, Mt. Gox halted all bitcoin withdrawals. The company said it was pausing withdrawal requests `to obtain a clear technical view of the currency processes`. On 24 February 2014, Mt. Gox suspended all trading, and hours later its website went offline, returning a blank page. Around 850,000 BTC (~$450M at the time) were stolen over several years. On 14 March 2019, the Tokyo District Court found KarpelÃ¨s guilty of falsifying data to inflate Mt. Gox's holdings by $33.5 million, for which he was sentenced to 30 months in prison, suspended for four years, meaning he will serve no time unless he commits additional offenses over the next four years.

crimeline.aftermath: Exchange filed for bankruptcy; creditors still awaiting payouts a decade later.

title: Ethereum Mainnet Launch
summary: Ethereum goes live with the Frontier release, introducing smart contracts and a Turing-complete blockchain.

title: The DAO Hack - ok can you guys stop trading
summary: An attacker exploits a reentrancy bug in The DAO smart contract, draining 3.6M ETH (~$60M), leading to the controversial Ethereum hard fork. When the DAO was being drained by an attacker (millions of ETH were being siphoned off due to a vulnerability), Vitalik and other Ethereum community members urged exchanges to pause trading, deposits, and withdrawals to prevent the stolen ETH from being quickly liquidated and causing further damage to the market.

crimeline.aftermath: Ethereum community split; hard fork created ETH and ETC chains.

title: Second Bitcoin Halving
summary: Bitcoin's block reward halves from 25 BTC to 12.5 BTC at block 420,000.

title: Bitfinex `Razzlekhan` Hack
summary: Hackers steal 119,756 BTC (~$72M) from Bitfinex exchange in the second largest Bitcoin theft at the time. In 2022, U.S. authorities arrested Ilya Lichtenstein and Heather `Razzlekhan` Morgan for laundering the stolen funds, marking one of the largest financial seizure cases ever. In 2026, Ilya Lichtenstein, was released early from prison under the First Step Act and is now on home confinement.

crimeline.aftermath: Bitfinex issued BFX tokens to affected users; DOJ later recovered some funds in 2022.

title: ICO Boom Begins
summary: Initial Coin Offerings explode in popularity, raising billions for blockchain projects with minimal regulation.

title: China Bans ICOs
summary: China's central bank declares all ICO fundraising illegal, triggering a market crash and setting a precedent for regulatory crackdowns.

title: Bitcoin Reaches $20,000
summary: Bitcoin hits its first major all-time high of nearly $20,000, capturing mainstream attention and sparking institutional interest.

title: Cryptopia Exchange Hack
summary: New Zealand-based Cryptopia exchange is hacked, losing approximately $16M in various cryptocurrencies.

crimeline.aftermath: Exchange went into liquidation; partial funds recovered for creditors.

title: PlusToken Ponzi Collapse
summary: PlusToken Ponzi scheme collapses after defrauding approximately $2B+ from Asian investors through fake cryptocurrency investment platform.

crimeline.aftermath: Chinese authorities arrested key operators; funds partially traced and seized.

title: Third Bitcoin Halving
summary: Bitcoin's block reward halves from 12.5 BTC to 6.25 BTC at block 630,000.

title: Uniswap V2 Launches
summary: Uniswap V2 launches with ERC20-ERC20 pools, flash swaps, and price oracles, becoming the leading decentralized exchange.

title: Defi Summer 2020
summary: Almost $90 billion worth of trading volume happened across decentralized exchanges on Ethereum over 2020. The majority of the volume and growth happened over the last 4-5 months during DeFi summer.

title: KuCoin Exchange Hack
summary: KuCoin suffers a major security breach with hackers stealing over $280M in various cryptocurrencies.

crimeline.aftermath: Most funds recovered through project freezes and law enforcement; exchange compensated users.

title: Poly Network Hack
summary: A hacker exploits Poly Network cross-chain protocol, stealing over $600M in the largest DeFi hack at the time. The hacker later returned most funds.

crimeline.aftermath: Hacker returned funds after negotiations; was offered security role.

title: Cream Finance Flash Loan Attack
summary: Cream Finance suffers its third hack of 2021, losing $130M in a sophisticated flash loan oracle manipulation attack.

crimeline.aftermath: Third major exploit for Cream; protocol credibility severely damaged.

title: Bitcoin Hits $69,000 ATH
summary: Bitcoin reaches all-time high of $69k, marking the peak of the 2021 bull run before a prolonged bear market.

title: Wormhole Bridge Hack
summary: Wormhole cross-chain bridge is exploited for 120,000 wETH (~$320M) due to a signature verification vulnerability.

crimeline.aftermath: Jump Crypto replaced the stolen funds to make users whole.

title: Ronin Bridge Hack
summary: North Korean hackers (Lazarus Group) exploit the Ronin bridge used by Axie Infinity, stealing $625M in the largest DeFi hack ever.

crimeline.aftermath: FBI attributed attack to Lazarus Group; Sky Mavis raised funds to reimburse users.

title: Terra/LUNA Collapse
summary: The UST algorithmic stablecoin loses its peg, triggering a death spiral that wipes out $40B+ in value and collapses the Terra ecosystem.

crimeline.aftermath: Do Kwon charged with fraud; triggered cascading failures across crypto lending platforms.

title: Celsius Network Freezes Withdrawals
summary: Crypto lender Celsius halts all withdrawals citing 'extreme market conditions,' later filing for bankruptcy with $4.7B hole.

crimeline.aftermath: Filed for bankruptcy; CEO Alex Mashinsky later arrested for fraud.

title: Three Arrows Capital Defaults
summary: Crypto hedge fund Three Arrows Capital defaults on over $3.5B in loans after LUNA collapse, triggering contagion across the industry.

crimeline.aftermath: Founders fled Singapore; creditors pursuing billions in claims.

title: Voyager Digital Bankruptcy
summary: Crypto broker Voyager files for bankruptcy after Three Arrows Capital default, leaving customers unable to access $1.3B in assets.

crimeline.aftermath: Bankruptcy proceedings; FTX initially bid to acquire before its own collapse.

title: Nomad Bridge Hack
summary: Nomad cross-chain bridge is drained of $190M in a chaotic 'free-for-all' attack where hundreds of users exploited a vulnerability.

crimeline.aftermath: First 'crowd-sourced' hack; some whitehats returned funds.

title: Ethereum Merge
summary: Ethereum successfully transitions from Proof of Work to Proof of Stake, reducing energy consumption by ~99.95%.

title: FTX Exchange Collapse
summary: FTX, the third-largest crypto exchange, files for bankruptcy after revelations of misusing $8B+ in customer funds through Alameda Research.

crimeline.aftermath: SBF arrested and convicted of fraud; sentenced to 25 years in prison.

title: Genesis Trading Bankruptcy
summary: Genesis Global Capital files for bankruptcy owing $3.5B to creditors after being hit by Three Arrows Capital and FTX collapses.

crimeline.aftermath: DCG parent company faced SEC charges; settlement reached with NY AG.

title: Euler Finance Flash Loan Attack
summary: Euler Finance lending protocol is exploited for $197M in a flash loan attack targeting the donation and liquidation mechanics.

crimeline.aftermath: Attacker negotiated return of funds after on-chain messages and negotiations.

title: SEC vs Ripple Partial Victory
summary: Judge rules XRP is not a security when sold on exchanges, marking a significant legal precedent for the crypto industry.

title: Mixin Network Hack
summary: Mixin Network cloud service provider is hacked, resulting in approximately $200M in losses from the decentralized network.

crimeline.aftermath: Network suspended deposits/withdrawals; offered 10% bug bounty to attacker.

title: SEC Twitter Hacked for Fake Bitcoin ETF Approval
summary: The SEC's official X account was compromised via SIM swap attack, posting a fake Bitcoin ETF approval that caused BTC to spike $1,000 then crash $2,000. Eric Council Jr. was later arrested for the hack.

crimeline.aftermath: FBI arrested Eric Council Jr. in October 2024. Real ETF approval came the next day.

title: Bitcoin Spot ETF Approved
summary: SEC approves 11 spot Bitcoin ETFs including BlackRock and Fidelity, marking a historic milestone for institutional crypto adoption.

title: Ansem Tweets About $WIF On Sphere
summary: A joke tweet about putting Dogwifhat (WIF) on the Las Vegas Sphere rapidly escalated into a community-funded campaign. Within hours, a fundraiser site was launched, and by March 13, 2024, Ansem announced the campaign was fully funded. Despite the successful fundraising, there has been no $WIF on Sphere.

title: $SLERF Developer Accidentally Burns $10M
summary: Slerf developer accidentally burned all $10M of presale investor funds while trying to distribute tokens. Instead of killing the project, the community rallied and pushed market cap to $660M, turning a disaster into a bizarre success story.

crimeline.aftermath: Community rallied, token reached $660M market cap. Became legendary meme moment.

title: 12-Year-Old Rug Pulls $QUANT for $20K
summary: A 12-year-old kid rug pulled $QUANT token for $20,000 during a live stream. Crypto Twitter responded by pumping the market cap to $85M to 'teach the kid a lesson' about the power of community.

root_cause: Exit scam by minor during livestream
crimeline.aftermath: Crypto Twitter pumped token to $85M market cap in retaliation. Became viral story.

title: Fourth Bitcoin Halving
summary: Bitcoin's block reward halves from 6.25 BTC to 3.125 BTC at block 840,000, continuing the predictable monetary policy.

title: Sahil Orchestrates Mass Celebrity Token Scam
summary: Sahil Arora convinced celebrities including Floyd Mayweather, Caitlyn Jenner, and Sexxy Redd to launch and promote tokens, then orchestrated coordinated rug pulls across all projects.

crimeline.aftermath: Exposed celebrity token scam operations. Multiple tokens crashed.

title: Church of the Chicken Pastor Scams Followers
summary: Pastor Kelby of the viral 'Church of the Chicken' used his religious influence to promote low-cap memecoins for payment, leading to his expulsion from the church he founded.

root_cause: Influencer using religious authority for financial gain
crimeline.aftermath: Pastor expelled from church, church plans collapsed.

title: Gainzy Falsely Named as UHC CEO Killer
summary: A viral post falsely accused crypto 'trader' Gainzy as the UnitedHealthcare CEO killer, sparking outrage and investigation from Crypto Twitter.

title: Radiant Capital Multi-Chain Hack
summary: Radiant Capital suffers a $50M exploit across Arbitrum and BNB Chain through compromised multi-sig signers.

crimeline.aftermath: Protocol paused lending markets; investigation ongoing.

title: Chill Guy Creator Opposes Memecoin
summary: The creator of the 'Chill Guy' art publicly opposed its use in crypto and threatened legal action. The Chill Guy memecoin reached $488 million market cap at its peak.

title: $HAWK Token Crashes After Launch
summary: Viral 'Hawk Tuah Girl' launched $HAWK token which immediately crashed.

crimeline.aftermath: Creator disappeared for 2 weeks. Became cautionary tale about celebrity tokens.

title: Bitcoin Breaks $100,000
summary: Bitcoin surpasses $100,000 for the first time, likely driven by ETF inflows and post-halving dynamics.

title: Scooter Exposes Rizzmas as Complete Scam
summary: Crypto influencer Scooter revealed Rizzmas was a complete scam.

root_cause: Coordinated scam targeting social media users
crimeline.aftermath: Market cap crashed from $100M to $20M after exposure. Whistleblower faced harassment.

title: $TRUMP Launch Sparks Frenzy, Then Massive Drawdown
summary: Donald Trump officially promotes the ($TRUMP) token, triggering a rapid speculative surge in January. Followed by a 90%+ drawdown by the end of the year.

title: $MELANIA Token Launches Immediately After $TRUMP
summary: The $MELANIA token had a peak market cap of aroun $150m, followed by a 98% drawdown over the year.

title: $LIBRA â€˜Cryptogateâ€™ Rug-Pull Scandal in Argentina
summary: Argentinaâ€™s President Javier Milei promoted the $LIBRA token, which rapidly pumped and then collapsed.

crimeline.aftermath: Political scandal (â€˜Cryptogateâ€™) and broad public scrutiny of memecoin launches tied to public figures.

title: Bybit Exchange Suffers Record $1.5B Ethereum Heist
summary: Dubai-based centralized exchange Bybit was hacked during a routine transfer between cold and warm wallets.

links.label: Decrypt: Bybit and Coinbase Biggest Hacks of 2025

root_cause: Compromised developer infrastructure at Safe{Wallet} (multi-sig provider)
crimeline.aftermath: Bybit pledged full client asset backing.

title: Bybit Suffers ~$1.5B Exchange Hack
summary: Bybit disclosed a major ETH wallet compromise that became the largest widely reported crypto heist to date in 2025.

crimeline.aftermath: Authorities issued attribution and laundering warnings.

title: Mantra (OM) Token Dumps ~90% in Hours
summary: OM experienced a rapid, severe collapseâ€”widely described as a â€˜token dumpâ€™.

crimeline.aftermath: Unkown

title: Coinbase Customer Data Breach via Rogue Support Agents
summary: Coinbase disclosed a major security breach in which cybercriminals bribed overseas customer support agents.

links.label: Decrypt: Bybit and Coinbase Biggest Hacks of 2025

root_cause: Bribery and recruitment of Coinbase support personnel
Insufficient internal access controls over sensitive user data
crimeline.aftermath: Coinbase refused the $20M ransom demand.

title: Cetus Protocol Smart Contract Exploit Drains $223M
summary: On Suiâ€™s largest decentralized exchange, Cetus Protocol suffered a major exploit.

links.label: Decrypt: Bybit and Coinbase Biggest Hacks of 2025

root_cause: Price manipulation via spoof token insertion
Smart contract vulnerability in AMM pricing feeds
crimeline.aftermath: Cetus paused operations.

title: Circle (CRCL) IPOs
summary: Circle, issuer of USDC, begins trading $31/share and at a valuation of $8 billion.

title: Nobitex Centralized Exchange Hack Drains ~$90M
summary: Iranâ€™s largest exchange Nobitex was hit by an exploit that drained around $90M.

links.label: Decrypt: Bybit and Coinbase Biggest Hacks of 2025

crimeline.aftermath: Nobitex temporarily suspended services.

title: GENIUS Act Signed Into Law
summary: President Trump signed the GENIUS Act into law.

title: Mass npm JavaScript Supply-Chain Attack Hits Widely Used Packages
summary: A large-scale supply-chain compromise targeted multiple high-download npm packages.

crimeline.aftermath: Security teams audited dependencies.

title: CZ-Linked $ASTER Debacle
summary: The CZ/Aster debacle centers on Changpeng Zhao (CZ), the former Binance CEO, heavily promoting and investing in Aster DEX and its token $ASTER in late 2025, driving massive hype, a Binance spot listing, and a price surge to an all-time high around $2.40 in September. However, subsequent issues—including airdrop delays, wash trading allegations leading to a brief DefiLlama delisting, technical glitches, rumored large dumps (which CZ denied), and ongoing monthly token unlocks—triggered sharp crashes, accusations of pump-and-dump manipulation, and heavy retail losses as the token fell over 70% to trade around $0.71 to $0.74 by early January 2026.

title: Cobie's UpOnly Returns After Coinbase Buys the $25m NFT
summary: Coinbase purchased the UpOnly NFT for $25M, triggering the podcasts return.

title: Cobie Sells Echo to Coinbase for ~$375M
summary: Coinbase agreed to acquire Echo in a deal reported at roughly $375M.

title: Upbit Solana Hot Wallet Hack (~$36M)
summary: South Korean exchange Upbit reported a hot wallet compromise where attackers stole around $36M in Solana-based assets.

links.label: Decrypt: Bybit and Coinbase Biggest Hacks of 2025

crimeline.victims_estimated: Upbit customers exposed to Solana assets
root_cause: Rapid exploit execution characteristic of state-linked hacking groups
crimeline.aftermath: Upbit moved remaining funds to cold storage.

title: First Chainlink Spot ETF Launches
summary: Grayscales Chainlink product converted/listed as GLNK on NYSE

title: Trust Wallet Chrome Extension Supply-Chain Compromise (v2.68)
summary: Trust Wallet reported that a malicious/unapproved Chrome extension release (v2.68) was published outside its standard process.

crimeline.aftermath: Extension rollout halted.

title: 100,000 Coinbase Customer Records Found Online
summary: Reports surfaced claiming 100,000 Coinbase customer records were being sold or shared online.

crimeline.aftermath: Coinbase investigated source of leak.

title: Running Bitcoin
summary: Hal Finney posts the first widely cited Bitcoin tweet, writing "Running bitcoin" as he tests the early software alongside Satoshi Nakamoto.

title: The Greg Schoen Regret
summary: A viral tweet laments selling 1,700 BTC at $0.30, becoming an early symbol of Bitcoin regret as prices climb.

title: Wikileaks Adoption
summary: Wikileaks begins accepting Bitcoin donations, a milestone that cements BTC as a censorship-resistant funding rail.

title: Satoshi’s Final Message
summary: Satoshi Nakamoto signs off with "I've moved on to other things," marking the creator's last known public communication.

title: The EFF Suspension
summary: The Electronic Frontier Foundation pauses Bitcoin donations, citing legal concerns during the early adoption period.

title: Casascius Physical Bitcoins
summary: Mike Caldwell mints the first Casascius physical Bitcoin coins, blending collectible tokens with real BTC value.

title: The Birth of Dogecoin
summary: Billy Markus and Jackson Palmer launch Dogecoin, turning a meme into one of crypto's most enduring communities.

title: The Creation of Maxcoin
summary: Maxcoin launches during the 2014 altcoin wave, marking an early high-profile celebrity-branded token experiment.

title: I Will Make You Obsolete
summary: Nicolas Dorier responds to BitPay with the iconic "I will make you obsolete" declaration, a rallying cry for user-controlled Bitcoin tools.

title: The BitConnect Keynote
summary: Carlos Matos delivers the "BitConnect" stage performance that becomes a viral symbol of the 2017 scam boom.

title: The Origin of HODL
summary: The "I AM HODLING" forum post typo becomes a rallying meme for long-term crypto holders.

title: The Bitcoin Cash Fork
summary: The Bitcoin Cash fork resolves the Block Size War by splitting Bitcoin into BTC and BCH chains.

title: The Birth of Inversebrah
summary: Inversebrah emerges as a satirical anon account following @cryptostardust's suspension.

title: The $20,000 Peak
summary: Bitcoin hits its first mainstream mania top near $20,000 during the 2017 bull market.

title: The Wassie Genesis
summary: The Wassie frog character rises as a symbol of the 2018 bear market and anon trading culture.

title: The "Bitcoin is Dead" 2018 Meta
summary: Media outlets repeatedly declare Bitcoin dead during the 2018 crash, cementing the recurring "Bitcoin is dead" meme.

title: The Binance SAFU Origin
summary: A typo of "Funds are safe" becomes "SAFU" and lives on as a crypto catchphrase.

title: The $3,100 Bottom
summary: Bitcoin finds a major bear market low near $3,100, closing out the 2018 downturn.

title: The Libra Announcement
summary: Facebook unveils Libra, an ambitious plan for a global digital currency that sparks immediate regulatory attention.

title: The Craig Wright "Satoshi" Claim
summary: Craig Wright repeatedly claims to be Satoshi Nakamoto, igniting ongoing legal and community disputes.

title: The PlusToken Ponzi
summary: PlusToken collapses as one of the largest crypto Ponzi schemes, later linked to major BTC selling pressure.

title: The March 12, 2020 Flash Crash
summary: Bitcoin drops roughly 50% in a day during the global liquidity crunch, shaking markets across crypto.

title: The COMP Launch
summary: Compound introduces COMP token incentives, kicking off the DeFi yield farming summer.

title: The YFI Fair Launch
summary: Andre Cronje launches YFI with a fair distribution, sending the "worthless" token to a $43k peak.

title: The SushiSwap Vampire Attack
summary: SushiSwap lures liquidity from Uniswap in a high-profile "vampire attack" during DeFi summer.

title: The Nomi Rug Return
summary: After community backlash, Chef Nomi returns $14M to SushiSwap, reversing a partial rug pull.

title: The UNI Airdrop
summary: Uniswap rewards past users with 400 UNI each, dubbed the DeFi "stimulus check."

title: MakerDAO "Black Thursday"
summary: Extreme volatility triggers zero-bid liquidations on MakerDAO, exposing risks in early DeFi collateral systems.

title: The Birth of (3,3) Lore
summary: OlympusDAO popularizes "(3,3)" game theory, defining a new wave of rebasing token culture.

title: The Twitter Help Desk Hack
summary: Hackers compromise high-profile Twitter accounts, including Obama and Musk, to run a Bitcoin giveaway scam.

title: The UpOnly Podcast Launch
summary: Cobie and Ledger launch the UpOnly podcast, giving the crypto degen community a weekly voice.

title: The MicroStrategy Buy
summary: MicroStrategy announces Bitcoin as a primary reserve asset, a pivotal corporate treasury move.

title: Elon Musk’s DOGE Bio
summary: Elon Musk changes his Twitter bio to reference Dogecoin, triggering a sudden DOGE pump.

title: The Tesla BTC Purchase
summary: Tesla reveals a $1.5B Bitcoin purchase, marking a landmark corporate adoption moment.

title: The SNL "Hustle" Moment
summary: Dogecoin dumps after Elon Musk calls it a "hustle" on Saturday Night Live.

title: The China Mining Ban
summary: China's crackdown on mining triggers a massive hash rate migration known as the Great Mining Exodus.

title: The El Salvador Legal Tender Act
summary: El Salvador adopts Bitcoin as legal tender, with President Bukele repeatedly "buying the dip."

title: The ConstitutionDAO Failure
summary: ConstitutionDAO raises $40M but fails to win the Constitution auction, refunding contributors.

title: The GCR $10M LUNA Bet
summary: GCR and Do Kwon publicly wager $10M on LUNA's future, a defining moment ahead of the collapse.

title: Your Size Is Not Size
summary: Do Kwon's "your size is not size" remark goes viral amid debate over LUNA's sustainability.

title: Steady Lads
summary: Do Kwon urges calm with "steady lads" as UST begins to unravel.

title: The GCR 72-Cent Hedge
summary: GCR buys cheap insurance to hedge a large LUNA short, later cited as a legendary trade.

title: The 3Arrows Capital Ghosting
summary: Founders Su Zhu and Kyle Davies disappear from public view as 3AC unravels.

title: The SBF Fortune Cover
summary: Fortune labels Sam Bankman-Fried the "next Warren Buffett," capturing peak FTX-era optimism.

title: The FTX "Bank Run"
summary: CZ announces Binance will liquidate FTT holdings, sparking a liquidity crisis at FTX.

title: I Fked Up
summary: Sam Bankman-Fried posts "I fked up" as the FTX collapse unfolds.

title: Martin Shkreli on UpOnly
summary: Martin Shkreli appears on UpOnly, an unlikely crossover during the post-FTX chaos.

title: The $15,000 BTC Bottom
summary: Bitcoin bottoms near $15,000 after the FTX collapse, marking the cycle low.

title: The "Bitcoin is Money" Lopp Tweet
summary: Jameson Lopp crystallizes Bitcoin's role with the concise "Bitcoin is money" statement.

title: The GCR "Final" Tweet
summary: GCR posts a final public note after calling the bottom, then goes dark.

title: The Ordinals Inscription
summary: Ordinals bring NFT-style inscriptions to Bitcoin mainnet, launching a new wave of on-chain art.

title: The $1.3 Million Frosties Arrest
summary: Authorities arrest the creators of the Frosties NFT project after an alleged rug pull.

title: The Squid Game Token Crash
summary: The Squid Game token spikes to $2,800 before crashing to near zero in a notorious rug pull.

title: The Axie Infinity $620M Hack
summary: The Ronin bridge breach drains about $620M, becoming the largest DeFi bridge hack at the time.

title: The Gary Gensler "I Will Resign" Tweet
summary: A viral fake resignation tweet highlights peak institutional tension around crypto regulation.

title: The PEPE 87 Millionaire
summary: Trader James Wynn turns $3k into $87M during the PEPE meme coin frenzy.

title: Trump Celebrating the Whitepaper
summary: Donald Trump signals pro-crypto positioning by celebrating the Bitcoin whitepaper anniversary.

title: The Unc Only Renaming
summary: Cobie embraces the aging degen persona, renaming UpOnly to "Unc Only."

title: The Gainzy Fat-Finger Rug
summary: Streamer Gainzy accidentally sells $gnzystrm live on stream, crashing the token price.

title: The Peanut the Squirrel (PNUT) Viral Pump
summary: A political-themed squirrel token rockets to a multibillion-dollar valuation during a meme coin surge.

title: The Truth Terminal AI Experiment
summary: Truth Terminal's "Goat Gospel" meme experiment spawns the $GOAT token and renewed AI narrative hype.

title: The Cobie Insider Trading Ident
summary: Cobie points to on-chain evidence suggesting insider trading at Coinbase, sparking debate.

title: The Snoop Dogg $12M Telegram Drop
summary: A Snoop Dogg-backed NFT release on Telegram highlights the rise of collectibles inside messaging apps.

title: The Cobie Pump.fun UPONLY Token Burn
summary: Cobie burns $17M worth of gifted Pump.fun tokens, calling out memecoin chaos.

title: Money Printing Won't Stop
summary: GCR's "money printing won't stop" post becomes a late-cycle mantra for long-term holders.

title: Zcash Core Developers Resign
summary: Multiple Zcash core developers resigned in early 2026, citing governance and strategic disagreements.
